title: Is the unconscious mind the soul? - Quora

response.answer_text: A seemingly simple, straightforward question. However, there are many levels of understanding and definition involved which could make any answers complicated. Having read some of the answers already submitted, I realise the truth of that statement. The body generates electrical fields, sometimes referred to as the etheric and the aura. They both have various levels / depths which, to some, are “visible”. To those who can routinely see the aura, it can be an indication of one’s health, one’s mood, etc. The etheric body can stay around for some time after physical death of the body. Are these then the soul? No, they are the product of physical, in-the-flesh life; mystical, yes, but not the soul. It is said that during “astral travel” the etheric body, or something like it, detaches from the physical body and goes off travelling, carrying awareness with it. Is this then the soul? No, it isn’t, so awareness (in this physical, space-time plane) is not the soul. Tibetan Lamas talk about the “Over-self”. Among its various interpretations, the mantra “Om Mane Padme Hum” can have the meaning “Hail to the Over-self”, an acknowledgement of a higher ‘self’. Is the Over-self the soul? We’re getting there. The Over-self is possibly part of the soul (not in quantity, but as a facet of the soul’s nature). It is an observer, a sometime “Guardian Angel”, a recorder of one’s akashic record. The soul is not a separate entity ‘belonging’ to a person’s physical body. The soul is a tendril of Cosmic soul placed into a body, let’s say “for the experience” - although, in this case, “for the experience” has a much deeper meaning than the superficial words. That collection of “experiences”, I think, may be passed through the Over-self into the soul, and thus through to the Cosmic soul. One of the ‘conduits’ for the passing of the “experiences” one way (“uploading”?), and ‘guidance’ the other way (in the form of conscience) (“downloading”?), is the “unconscious mind”. So is the unconscious mind the soul? I don’t think so, but I think it is an important conduit for communication between our space-time, carnal awareness and our soul. See? Even though I wanted to keep it simple, once one starts on this subject, the mind (sic) takes one off on a journey, some might say of discovery, others might say a flight of fancy. In the long run, that doesn’t matter. We’re all on our own road of discovery. On that note, I should close with the statement that I am not preaching that my interpretation is the truth, the only truth, etc. It is merely a clumsy attempt to describe something in a way that I ‘sort of’ see it at my current level of development, using words which can never be succinct enough to create a clear picture. “Om Mane Padme Hum”.
